channel.title: Html
channel.description:
ok im starting to learn html and i would like to ask a few questions
1.how can i add a backround to my pages -i would like to no this one!
2.how can i have more than one page as in im using TextPad so do you have to make a new blank page and them hyperlink it to the new page if so how do i hyperlink if ive got the pages offline and in a folder
3.what is the standard size for a webpage, webpage backrounds, web page text.
4.colours they have codes? i video tut i tryed to load wont load on any of my 3 computers so i cant view about colour
this is the one i would like to get answered how can i add a button witch a text field so if some one enters something into that text box and presses "continue" it would take them to a new page but save that information somewhere that the site owner can view and maby have more than one text field to that button
that's all i can think of rite now but if i think on any more ill update p.s please don't say google ive done it and it dosent help me out

item.title: Html

item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

i learnt how to put a background in on my own but please still make me a tut on how to use it p.s some one should make a simple tut on html but make it a vid tut[br][size=1]Posted at: December 01, 2006, 06:42:11 PM[/size][hr]thank you very much still dont realy get how to make the link to a new page :s

Read full topic

item.title: Html
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

  1. CSS:

body { background: #000000 url('http://'); }

[b]HTML[b]
Replace

<body>

With

<body background="http://">
  1. Make a new file, put the usual code in it, upload it, then link to it…
<a href="http://www.yoursite.com/newpage.html" alt="description" border="0"> Newpage </a>

  1. Text Size: 10-14px any between there look good.
    Site Width: 796 pixels, or use percentages. For example, anywhere you have a width for something, use like… ___% instead (100% on the width will make your site stretch across your screen no matter what size the window or computer resolution).

  2. Colors correspond to different numbers and letters. #000000 is black. #FFFFFF is white. #FF0000 is red. F is the lightest you can go, 0 is the darkest.

Order (light>dark): FEDCBA9876543210

Note: Each color MUST have 6 spots unless they are all the same (000000 or FFFFFF), you can just use 3 spots (000 or FFF).

5 (text button, etc…). For this, you need to use PHP and MySQL together. I have no idea how to do it though.

-Alexia

Read full topic
